jurisdiction.title: Roman Catholic Diocese of Joliet Illinois

C3B34570DF8D432DA0572E2EC8C13A32.description:
Explain how laws and government
policies affecting the economy have
changed over time.

51736C0801814A50A84D3A9157517EEE.description:
Discuss the role we all play in
protecting the poor and vulnerable.

E26EB4FA60454A16804474DB6549EEEB.description:
Explain why there is a role for
government in the economy.

97162908E414438999BC9ED6BFA7C757.description:
Identify laws and government policies
that protect property rights, enforce
contracts, and maintain competition.

FB10FC350E214AFCA5C1735A926609AF.description: Understand the impact of government policies and decisions on production and consumption in the economy. Understand the moral implications of policies and decisions on production and consumption. Explain how one’s beliefs about God, about humanity, and about material things, affect one’s actions. CSIS7 (K-6 CS)      Demonstrate the ways men and societies change and/or persist over time to better understand the human condition. CSIS8 (7&8)

DD71432BB1FB4B6B8D36B43783A0627F.description:
Identify new technologies over time and
explain their impact on the economy.

85F5F37BA3FE49D4848456641FB0D459.description:
Explain how materialism should be
tempered by a sense of justice and
trade should be based on mutual
benefit.

2BFA2620965C4B4A8F645C52DA29B9AC.description:
Explain how people’s incomes reflect
choices they have made about
education, training, skill development,
and careers.

2D55BB0D6C2F4013A7B5684B69BFF68E.description:
Explain how technological changes
have led to new and improved
products.

203ADA480E6D458AA6AE47A22CCC98A9.description:
Provide examples of how specialization
increases interdependence among
consumers and producers.

8AFEF7F78E1942C6AF936471F1C91206.description:
Explain how specialization usually
increases productivity in an economy.

99AC075AAF654FAFA3D3DC08018301B0.description:
Explain why countries benefit when
they exchange goods and services.

0CCB4AA6A4D949DABDE64C6268642FA9.description:
Identify exports produced in the local
community or state.

E673539C493042B2AC394F6850913EED.description: Understanding trade as an exchange of goods or services. Understand moral values behind the understanding of trade as an exchange of goods and services. Explain how one’s beliefs about God, about humanity, and about material things, affect one’s actions. CSIS7       Value one’s own role and dignity as man in God’s plan and creation. CSGS5 (7&8)

73E195BECDD441A58F86977131FB6144.description:
Predict the impact on supply of a goods
or service when non-price determinants
change (e.g., number of producers; cost
of production).

2D8952AFC5FD48D5B349F03B1E12E432.description:
Explain why people’s response to an
incentive may vary because of differing
values or influenced by religious
teaching.

43CD64CC09DE4047B526D1355256E700.description:
Analyze how changes in price affect
producer behavior.

ED55DC40D72A4AB8A6AFB606F772FC99.description:
Understand that scarcity necessitates choices by producers. Understand that scarcity necessitates producer choices which have moral implications. Explain how one’s beliefs about God, about humanity, and about material things, affect one’s actions. CSIS7          Value and develop a love for the common good and our shared humanity, not just with those around us, but for those who have gone before
and those who will come after us. CSDS2 (7-12 CS)

F403C1DDD5164DC497E3D4BCBFBB4C9A.description:
Analyze the impact on prices of
competition among buyers as measured
by our responsibility as stewards of
God’s creation.

C541901A0952449C88A060023977B15F.description:
Explain the benefits to consumers of
competition among sellers.

F912E947DDCA40F9B893DD9B53B88343.description:
Identify markets where buyers and
sellers meet face-to-face and markets in
which buyers and sellers never meet
directly.

0A99A0B44F5945D88876B09A77F85756.description:
Explain why people are both consumers
and producers.

5836DD96481E4A099BBDFB4E11ED4AA6.description:
Understand that scarcity necessitates choices by consumers. Understand that scarcity necessitates consumer choices which have moral implications. Discriminate between what is positive in the world, what needs to be transformed, and what injustices must be overcome. CSDS4
Explain how one’s beliefs about God, about humanity, and about material things, affect one’s actions. CSIS7

4A9B67D3F3D348188AB99FA8A7D45F94.description:
Discuss the relationship between
productivity and wages based on the
Church’s teaching about dignity and
rights of the worker.

8A8CD665EB034D118E3E53931D5B2247.description:
Identify times when students or adults
are consumers and when students or
adults are producers.

FE90BB9E01BF408BADD51869E58F6169.description:
Explain the relationship between
productive resources households sell to
businesses and the goods and services
businesses sell to households. Include
the payments received.

9271B6BCEA5B47CF9B821AE573A68AFF.description:
Explain that consumer demand
determines what producers will
produce in a market economy.

5BA2C55640E440AEA3A26A1F50B60605.description:
Understand how different economic systems operate in exchange, production, distribution and consumption of goods and services. Understand the moral consequences of how different economic systems operate in exchange, production, distribution and consumption of goods and services. Identify the motivating values that have informed particular societies and how they correlate with Catholic teaching. CSIS7 (7-12 CS)
Explain how one’s beliefs about God, about humanity, and about material things, affect one’s actions .CSIS 7 (K-6 CS)       Distinguish the religious dimensions and basic elements of Christian social ethics within historical events. CSIS19 (7& 8)

296FFB4ADBC54E8CB674434075E03006.description: Understand economic systems with an emphasis on the United States. Understand moral aspects of the economic systems of the United States.
